Caption: Figure 1: Tracefs is a stackable file system located above the lower file system and below the VFS.
Mention:
tured. As shown in Figure 1, Tracefs [2] is a stackable
le system [40]. Tracefs passes through all the Virtual
File System (VFS) requests down to the lower le system
(or a tree of several mounted le systems). Before invok-
ing the lower operations and after returning from them,
Tracefs logs the input and output values and the timing
information associated with the requests. Replayfs is log-
ically located at the same level as Tracefsright above
the lower le system as shown in Figure 2. However, Re-
playfs is not a stackable le system; it is not a le system
either. It reproduces the behavior of the VFS during the
trace capture time and appears like a VFS for the lower
le system. Replayfs operates similarly to the part of the
VFS which directly interacts with lower le systems.
